title: sending emails
content:
Everytime I open up Thunderbird to try to send an email, it says “Login to server pop.shaw.ca with username ricc failed”

It also says “Cannot get mail. The mail server “imap.shaw.ca” is not responding. Verify that you have entered the correct account info in Mail Settings.”

It also says “login to server pop.shaw.ca with username ricc failed” “Enter your password for ricc on imap.shaw.ca”

This on an IOS device (ipod 7)

My isp won;t help because they say they don’t support a third party application, so can you help? My hospital phone doesn;t do toll free or long distance calls
creator: hap2

title: Firefox site crashes error
content:
Hi! I had my computer off for the past 3/4 days due to a little getaway. I just came back ready to finish up some stuff and all, but whenever I open any page it shows (translated to english) - "Oh - this card has crashed". Under that there is a text, along with three buttons, that translates to:

We can help! Use the "Restore Tab" or "Restore All Tabs" button to reload the page or pages. "Close tab" "restore tab" "restore all tabs"

but whenever i click restore, it just loads for a few seconds and goes back to the crash error. It's seriously annoying and the whole thing is running slowly. How can I fix that up? (firefox is the only app with the problem, i run a virus/ comp cleaner twice and it showed nothing) Sorry for any spelling mistakes! Appreciate any tips with the issue
creator: viviantte.official

title: Managed by organisation - no Mozilla policy
content:
I recently noticed that in the settings it says "Your browser is being managed by your organisation". The certificate "ImportEnterpriseRoots" seems to be affected. I have seen guides saying to delete a registry key but I do not have a Mozilla folder in my policies.

It is worth noting I do run two anti virus software. Kaspersky total security and gridinsoft anti malware. Just wondering if there is a way to permanently remove this or if its just a side affect of my anti virus software.

Thanks
creator: ETERNALVOID

title: i can't log in to my email (davidfthomas@rogers.com) when using Firefox.
content: I have used Firefox for years and never had a problem logging in to my email (davidfthomas@rogers.com) until a month or so ago. I can log in using Chrome but can't using Firefox. I have gone through all the debugging steps with my internet supplier (Rogers) and they ask if Firefox can review and help.

title: Not displaying ICONs and color
content:
Firefox is not displaying all ICONs and color from websites like Office 365. ICON show as text boxes and the one line version of Excel will not display color. I have included pictures of both. Both show correctly in all other browsers. I prefer Firefox but with these issues, I cannot use it. I also notice that on this page after I uploaded the pictures only a - showed for each. I have also noticed that when checking boxes or making selections for many sites there is no indication of the selection being made. For instance, I clicked the e-mail me box but no check appeared so please e-mail me anyway.

Thank You

title: Some website display the letters "fi" as "Y".  This seems to be a problem in translating the ASCII code to English text.
content:
Some websites display the letters "fi" as "Y". This seems to be a problem in translating the ASCII code to English text. This doesn't happen on all websites but Wikipedia seems to be the main culprit.

Any suggestions how I can fix it?

Incidentally, this only happens on my MacBook; not on my desktop Mac. And both are using the latest version of Firefox.
creator: eddleetham

title: Issue with embedded hyperlinks in a 'secure' website.
content:
I'm using Firefox on my Mac, and I'm really pleased with it so far, but I have a small issue on a specific website.

I can't share the website with you because it's behind the login details of my pension provider, sorry, but essentially the problem is with the hyperlinks to my monthly pension slips. When I click them, nothing happens, that I'm aware of, at least.

If I login to the same website using Safari (it's the only other browser installed), clicking on the link opens a preview of the PDF document on the open webpage (it doesn't open a new tab or window), but it's this that doesn't seem to be working in Firefox. However, if I click on the link and then the Download PDF link, the correct document downloads as expected, just no preview.

Is there a Firefox setting that could help with this, or is it more a compatibility issue in the website's design?

Thank you.
creator: Nightowl999

title: I can nolonger log into my bank ... National Australia Bank
content:
Hi

I log into my bank (in Australia) NAB almost every day. For about several weeks now when I successfully log in to the site it says "Service Temporarily Unavailable. Please try Later". However, if I use Chrome and log in (immediately after trying it wit Firefox) it logs in every time.

Can you please help me understand what might be stopping me from using Firefox on NAB website?

title: URGENT HELP LOCKED OUT OF ACCOUNT HELP ME
content: I have literally been crying for what seems like the past hour because I have been locked out of my actual firefox account. Can I get in touch with a developer or staff member who can please help me? Help me please this is the only thing I have been able to find I am so confused and scared help me please I am locked out of my account.

title: Ticketmaster resistance..see message below..
content:
I've tried to purchase tickets and the web sites direct me to Ticketmaster. When I get to Ticketmaster I get the message below:


Pardon the Interruption As you were browsing something about your browser made us think you were a bot. There are a few reasons this might happen: 

   You're a power user moving through this website with super-human speed.    You've disabled JavaScript in your web browser    A third-party browser plugin, such as Ghostery or NoScript is preventing JavaScript from running.

title: Unexpected Refresh after Midnight
